translator
Class JavaType

java.lang.Object
  translator.JavaType
Direct Known Subclasses:
JavaType.Object, JavaType.Primitive
public abstract class JavaType
extends java.lang.Object

The current setup for expressions requires this class.

isPrimitive

public boolean isPrimitive()
Are we just a wee primitive? No need to push this off to the inner classes as there will only ever be two, and putting them there is just adding more code...but we could. Eh. This works.

hasParent

protected abstract boolean hasParent(JavaType parent)
Determines if we are a child of some parent class. Will only ever be called when the object is the same class as the parent; that is, it will only be called when (this.getClass() == parent.getClass()), so you do not need to worry about checks like that.

isChildOf

public boolean isChildOf(JavaType parent)
Determines if we are a subclass / sub-primitive of the given type. In other words, given another JavaType, it determines if that JavaType is one of our parents. Note: a class is a child of itself.
